name: Lazer X
details: This laser tag arena also has arcade games to play.

name: K1 Speed
details: Indoor go-kart racing at these three locations.

name: Astro Fun World
details: Glow-in-the-dark fun for all ages. Come check out this fun center to find mini golf, Go Karts, a ropes course, zip line, rock climbing, and more! Everything inside lights up with cool glow-in-the-dark effects. You’ll also find a kids play zone, virtual reality games, and arcade games.
address: Astro Fun World301 South Route 59Aurora, IL 60504(630) 206-0267Website | Facebook | Instagram

name: Mega Fun Park
details: Arcade games, trampolines, foam pits, rock climbing, inflatables, ninja course, zip-lining, and indoor play area.

name: Round 1
details: Select locations offer expansive arcade rooms, along with bowling, karaoke, ping pong, darts, and billiards.

name: Yetee Station
details: Unlimited arcade game play for one admission price.

name: Funway Entertainment Center
details: Arcade, bowling, bumper cars, laser tag, mini golf, and roller skating are all available; see website for attraction hours.

name: Prince Arcades
details: Located at The Promenade in Bolingbrook, this arcade’s games and pinball machines are set to unlimited free play. All-day admission is per person. Check the website for days and hours.

name: Galloping Ghost Arcade
details: Play unlimited games after paying the single entrance fee.

name: Trails Entertainment Centers
details: Trails Entertainment Centers offers three amazing venues – Enchanted Castle Family Entertainment Center in Lombard – a 60,000 square foot all-indoor fun center, and two Haunted Trails Family Entertainment Centers located in Burbank and Joliet, which feature both indoor and outdoor attractions. Each location offers a unique variety of games, miniature golf, go-karts, amusement rides, and other special attractions. Discounted rates are available for birthday parties, group outings, and corporate picnics & events. For more information visit trailsfunparks.com.
address: Trails Entertainment CentersEnchanted Castle Lombard | Haunted Trails Joliet | Haunted Trails Burbank

name: Haunted Trails Family Entertainment Center
details: Prize redemption arcade, outdoor go-karts, mini-golf, batting cages, and amusement rides.

name: Dads Slot Cars
details: Family owned slot car racing open on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays.

name: PGN Fun Village
details: A castle-themed family fun center with outdoor mini-golf, a three-story indoor playland, driving ranges, and arcade and redemption games.

name: Haunted Trails Joliet
details: Prize redemption arcade, outdoor go-karts, mini-golf, batting cages, and amusement rides.

name: Scrims Esports Gaming Center
details: Scrims Center is a modern-day arcade featuring a mix of high-end gaming PCs, Virtual Reality, and gaming consoles.

name: Enchanted Castle
details: This entertainment center includes a game room, mini golf, bumper cars, Go Karts, laser tag, and a restaurant.

name: The Game Show
details: Family-friendly arcade in Yorktown Center with video arcade games from the 1980’s and 90’s, as well as pinball, air hockey, basketball, foosball, and Skee-Ball.

name: Game Show Battle Rooms
details: Face off against friends and family in a game show setting.

name: Urban Air Trampoline and Adventure Park
details: While Urban Air is known for is trampolines and climbing walls, visitors will also find indoor go-karting and bumper cars.

name: Chasers Laser Tag
details: Laser tag, arcade games, indoor play space, and concessions. Open for private reservations as well as hourly play.

name: Nickel City Xtreme
details: Play traditional arcade and video games.

name: Sandbox VR
details: Virtual reality experience taking reservations.

name: Gizmos Fun Factory
details: You’ll find indoor bumper cars, go-karting, laser tag, and more than 70 arcade games, as well as indoor climbing spaces.

name: Scene75
details: This spot in Romeoville has pay-as-you-go attractions including arcade games, laser tag, go-karts, an indoor roller coaster, bumper cars, a drop tower, mini golf, and inflatables. Check out Katie’s review of Scene75.

name: Enterrium
details: Bowling and arcade games, along with a full service menu and bar.

name: Safari Land
details: Indoor rides, bowling, and play areas in addition to an arcade with games and a ticket redemption center.

name: Main Event Entertainment
details: Locations offer bowling, multi-level laser tag, billiards, virtual reality, and arcade games. Amenities may vary by location.

name: Papa Passeros Pizza
details: This family-owned pizzeria has a kid’s game room.

name: Bowlero
details: Bowling, plus an arcade area with games and billards.

name: Chuck E Cheese
details:
Food, games, and prizes at this classic kids’ entertainment option.
Check out our list of kid-friendly bowling spots, or more ideas for indoor fun with kids in the western suburbs of Chicago!
